name: Sneaker Price Drop Alerts with Bright Data & n8n

description:
# 
## Description

This workflow automatically monitors sneaker prices across multiple retailers and sends you alerts when prices drop on your favorite models. It helps sneaker enthusiasts and collectors find the best deals without constantly checking multiple websites.

## Overview

This workflow automatically monitors sneaker prices across multiple retailers and sends you alerts when prices drop. It uses Bright Data to scrape sneaker websites and can notify you through various channels when your desired models go on sale.

### Tools Used

*   **n8n:** The automation platform that orchestrates the workflow.
*   **Bright Data:** For scraping sneaker retailer websites without getting blocked.
*   **Notification Services:** Email, SMS, or other messaging platforms.

## How to Install

1.  **Import the Workflow:** Download the `.json` file and import it into your n8n instance.
2.  **Configure Bright Data:** Add your Bright Data credentials to the Bright Data node.
3.  **Set Up Notifications:** Configure your preferred notification method.
4.  **Customize:** Add the sneaker models you want to track and your price thresholds.

## Use Cases

*   **Sneaker Collectors:** Get notified when rare models drop in price.
*   **Resellers:** Find profitable buying opportunities.
*   **Budget Shoppers:** Wait for the best deals on your favorite sneakers.

---

## Connect with Me

*   **Website:** [https://www.nofluff.online](https://www.nofluff.online)
*   **YouTube:** [https://www.youtube.com/@YaronBeen/videos](https://www.youtube.com/@YaronBeen/videos)
*   **LinkedIn:** [https://www.linkedin.com/in/yaronbeen/](https://www.linkedin.com/in/yaronbeen/)
*   **Get Bright Data:** [https://get.brightdata.com/1tndi4600b25](https://get.brightdata.com/1tndi4600b25) (Using this link supports my free workflows with a small commission)

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.

parameters.content:
=======================================
            WORKFLOW ASSISTANCE
=======================================
For any questions or support, please contact:
    Yaron@nofluff.online

Explore more tips and tutorials here:
   - YouTube: https://www.youtube.com/@YaronBeen/videos
   - LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/in/yaronbeen/
=======================================

# üëü **Sneaker Price Drop Alert Automation**

> *Track sneaker prices on resale sites and get alerted via email when prices drop below your set budget.*

---

## üü¢ **SECTION 1: Scheduled Price Scraping via Bright Data**

### üß≠ **Nodes Involved**:

1. üïí **Schedule Trigger ‚Äî ‚ÄúRun Price Monitor Everyday‚Äù**
2. üåê **HTTP Request ‚Äî ‚ÄúBright Data Scraper‚Äù**

### üß† **What This Section Does**:

This section **automatically kicks off your sneaker tracking** every day without needing to press any buttons.

* **üïí Schedule Trigger**: Think of this like an alarm clock for your workflow. It runs once a day (or more often if you want).
* **üåê HTTP Request (Bright Data)**: Uses Bright Data‚Äôs **Web Unlocker** to scrape StockX or GOAT without getting blocked. This handles bot protection and gives you the full HTML content.

### üõ†Ô∏è **Beginner Tip**:

You don‚Äôt have to be a coder or open the browser. Just schedule it and forget it‚Äîn8n + Bright Data handles it.

---

## üü° **SECTION 2: Extract Sneaker Info from HTML**

### üß± **Nodes Involved**:

3. üßæ **HTML Extractor ‚Äî ‚ÄúextractHtmlContent‚Äù**
4. üì¶ **Function ‚Äî ‚ÄúExtract Title & Price‚Äù**

### üß† **What This Section Does**:

This section **pulls out useful info from the webpage** ‚Äî like the sneaker's name and its price.

* **üßæ HTML Extractor**: Converts raw HTML into a structured format so we can easily extract text.
* **üì¶ Extract Title & Price**: Goes through the HTML and collects the sneaker name and price. It also converts prices from strings like `"$223"` to usable numbers like `223`.

### üõ†Ô∏è **Beginner Tip**:

Webpages are full of clutter. This part filters that clutter and gets only what you care about: name + price.

---

## üî¥ **SECTION 3: Check for Deals & Send Alerts**

### üì§ **Nodes Involved**:

5. ‚öñÔ∏è **IF Node ‚Äî ‚ÄúCheck Price < Threshold‚Äù**
6. üìß **Gmail Node ‚Äî ‚ÄúSend Price Drop Email Alert‚Äù**
7. ‚õî **No Operation ‚Äî ‚ÄúDo Nothing‚Äù**

### üß† **What This Section Does**:

This is the brain of the automation. It **decides whether a sneaker's price is good enough to alert you**, and then takes action.

* **‚öñÔ∏è IF Node**: Checks if the sneaker's price is below your target (e.g. \$250). You can change this number anytime.
* **üìß Gmail Node**: If a good deal is found, sends you an alert with the sneaker‚Äôs name and current price.
* **‚õî No Operation**: If the price is too high, it simply does nothing and ends the workflow.

### üõ†Ô∏è **Beginner Tip**:

You're not flooded with emails‚Äîonly alerted when a good deal hits your threshold. Smart automation = peace of mind.

---

## ‚úÖ **Why This Workflow is Powerful for Beginners**

| Feature             | Benefit                                          |
| ------------------- | ------------------------------------------------ |
| ‚è∞ Scheduled         | Set it once, runs forever on autopilot.          |
| üí° No Coding Needed | All logic is visual and editable.                |
| üíå Smart Alerts     | Only get emails when prices are *actually* good. |
| üîê Web Unlocker     | Gets past tough sites like StockX with ease.     |

---

## üì¶ Bonus Suggestion:

Want to track multiple sneaker models? Just **clone the HTTP node and update the query** (e.g. `Jordan+4`, `Yeezy+Foam`, etc.)

---

parameters.subject: =The sneaker {{ $json.title }} has dropped below your threshold price.
